intro: Ferolia oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ferolia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are elongated and often have a slightly serrated edge. Its small white flowers are clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Ferolia oblongifolia is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
